inventory.commentary: Contains duplicate mappings for WN sense 2

sense.name: Leave a location or a concrete entity behind.
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] DESERT NP2[location] NP1[agent] DESERT NP2[patient[concrete]]
sense.examples: The soldiers deserted the army. A mother can't just desert her child. How can you desert me like this? The far right deserted the politician in favor of someone more conservative. The students deserted the campus after the end of the exam period.

sense.name: Discard an idea, belief, mental state, or mode of living.
sense.examples: Frege deserted the idea of concrete entities in propositions. He has deserted his Christian upbringing. She is held up a poster child for a movement that advocates that people desert 'sinful' lifestyles. They deserted the notion of moving upstate following graduation.
